description: The construction of a B8 distribution centre for supermarket home deliveries, a new vehicle maintenance building, gatehouse, a vehicle fuelling and washing facility and associated car and van parking
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The material to be used for the external surfaces of the development indicated on the elevational drawings P04 Rev B and in the Design and Access Statement, prepared by Ashton Smith (dated May 2009) shall be in place prior to occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | If any works are necessary to protect the trees within the adjacent Site of Metropolitan and Local Importance for Nature Conservation (adjacent to the site), details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be implemented prior to commencement of the development and retained until it is completed.  No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.   REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 9 : 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development and maintained in accordance with these standards.  REASON: To provide adequate lighting to the proposed development and protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties and the amenity of the adjoining Site of Importance for Nature Conservation, in accordance with policies 3.6 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed noise barrier and acoustic screen proposed on drawing no P02/F-A1 of 3 metres in height in order to mitigate noise from car parking activity, the proposed jet wash and service vehicles shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development. The noise barriers shal be manufactured and consturcted to the Authority's specifications as required in the London Borough of Ealing Environmental Health  Department Document 5.3, "Guidance for Developers".  Within two months of of the installation of these works, noise readings shall be taken at the neighbouring residential properties in Carr Road and Rothesay Avenue to ensure the noise barriers are meeting the standards set out in the adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. If the works fail to comply with these standards, details of additional noise mitigation measures shall, within one month of the testing, be submitted to the local planning authority and the approved details of mitigation shall be implemented within two months of the date of the decision. Further noise readings will be undertaken at the neighbouring residential properties within one month of their implementation. If a satisfactory noise level is not achieved, the above procedure shall be repeated until such time as the Council's noise attenuation standards have been met.   REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10:'Noise and Vibration'. | Refuse and Recycling storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided. Such provision shall be installed and implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	  REASON:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the submitted Travel Plan, a Travel Management plan to serve the development to be implemented in accordance with SPG21 - 'Sustainable Transport:Green Travel Plans', shall be submitted to the local planning authority, prior to occupation providing details of :	 - A Travel Plan Co-ordinator (TPC) employed prior to occupation and the contact details of the TPC will be provided to LB Ealing and WestTrans upon employment.+	 - A monitoring schedule agreed with the London Borough of Ealing with a baseline after 3months (as stated), then for years 1, 3 & 5. - A commitment to the implementation of additional/remedial measures should they not meet their targets. - A commitment to petition the owners of the industrial estate to improve the permeability of the site for pedestrians and cyclists by creating new links to surrounding roads and the canal.  REASON: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 21: 'Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans'. | The general and disabled car parking spaces shown on approved plan P02/F-A1 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose.  No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.	  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and that excessive parking is not provided in pursuance of the traffic restraint policies of the Council and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 'Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans'. | The submitted loading, servicing and travel details of HGV(Heavy Goods Vehicles) and van movements shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.   REASON: To ensure that suitable access, servicing and lorry parking space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Cycle parking for 24 cycles in accordance with the approved details shall be in place prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with Policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Any externally sited plant or machinery audible outside the premises shall be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 35 Leq, 5min, when running during the periods of 2300-0700 hrs Monday to Friday and any time at weekends and NR40 Leq, 1hr when running during the period 0700-2300 hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties in accordance with policies 4.1 anf 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitatry Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's adopted Suppplementary Planning Guidance note 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | No external plant or machinery shall be permitted except in accordance with an approval of details by the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.   REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Only white noise reversing sounders shall be fitted to vehicles visiting the site.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note  10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Any occupants of the building hereby approved who propose to operate a fleet of vehicles from the site shall submit to the Local Planning Authority details of a Green Fleet Management Plan prior to occupation. The Management Plan shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be implemented as approved for the lifetime of their occupancy.  REASON:   In the interests of air quality, in accordance with policy 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 3: 'Air Quality and Pollution'. | Prior to commencement of the development, details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the building hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the development.  REASON: To ensure that the building is acceptable in terms of the Local Planning Authority's energy policies, in accordance with policy 2.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Petrol/oil interceptors shall be fitted to all car parking/washing/repair facilities within the development hereby approved.  REASON: To prevent pollution of the water environment, in accordance with policy 2.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be constructed as approved and in accordance with the details set out in the submitted Design and Access Statement.  REASON: To ensure suitable access is provided for people with disabilities, in accordance with policy 4.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | All heavy goods vehicle and delivery van movements to and from the site associated with the use hereby permitted shall be routed to and from the main highway network (Greenford Road, A4127) via Auriol Drive, Oldfield Lane North and Rockware Avenue. Only those delivery vehicles serving the properties in the residential streets off Oldfield Lane North will be allowed to travel north from the junction of Auriol Drive/Oldfield Lane North.  Reason : To prevent commercial traffic used in conjunction with the distribution centre from rat running through residential streets and to direct commercial traffic to the main road network in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety and the amenities of the occupiers of residential properties within the vicinity of the site, in pursuance of policies 4.1, 4.11, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004.
